毦字的基本解释

毦
ěr
用鸟羽兽毛做的装饰品。
毡类毛织品。
用羽毛编织的衣服。
草花。

毦字的汉语字典释义

[①]［èr］
［《廣韻》仍吏切，去志，日。］
(1)以鸟羽或兽毛做成的装饰物，常用以饰头盔、犬马或兵器。
(2)草花。
(3)见“毦筆”。

毦字的康熙字典解释

【辰集下】【毛字部】　毦； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页592第41
【唐韻】【集韻】?仍吏切，音餌。【說文】羽毛飾也。【博雅】㲥毦，罽也。一曰績羽爲衣。一曰兜鍪上飾。【後漢·單超傳】金銀罽毦，施於犬馬。【註】毦，以羽毛爲飾。音如志反。又【西南夷傳】齎黃金、旄牛毦。【註】顧野王曰：毦，結毛爲飾，卽今馬及弓槊上纓毦也。【魏略】劉備性好結毦，有人以髦牛尾與備者，因手自結之。又【諸葛亮·答孫權書】所遺白毦薄少，重見辭謝，益以增慙。【女紅餘志】臨川王宏妾江無畏善騎馬，翠毦珠羈，玉珂金鐙。【庾信詩】金羈翠毦往交河。　又冠上飾。【董巴·輿服志】內常侍加黃金，附蟬毦尾，謂之惠文冠。　又拂名。【晉東宮舊事】皇太子納?，有白毦拂二枚。　又錦名。【內典·翻譯名義集】兜羅錦，亦翻揚華，或稱兜羅毦。　又香草之稱。【郭璞·江賦】揚皓毦，擢紫茸。【註】毦與茸皆香草也。　又藤名。【齊民要術】毦藤，大小如苹蒿，蔓衍生。○按《服虔·通俗文》毛飾曰毦，則凡絲羽革草之下垂者，?可以毦名矣。　與目部眊不同。【正韻牋補】毦从耳。誤从目，讀作眊，謂?德好結帽

小篆楷体

字形对比：

毦字的起名意思

暂无。

Grate
Basic explanation of words
Grate
ěr
Ornaments made of bird feathers and animal hair.
Felt woolen fabrics.
Clothes knitted with feathers.
Grass flower.
Grate
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [èr]
["Guangyun" is still cutting, go to the record, day. ]
(1) Decorative objects made of bird feathers or animal hair are often used to decorate helmets, horses, or weapons.
(2) Grass and flowers.
(3) See "Round Pen".
Grate
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Jixia] [Mao Character Department] 　毦; Kangxi Strokes: 10; Page Number: Page 592 41
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun]? Still cutting, sound bait. [Said the text] Feathers are also decorated. 【Bo Ya】㲥毦，罽也. One said Ji Yu is clothing. One said the tops of the pockets. [Later Han·Shan Chao Chuan] Jinyin 罽 grate, applied to dogs and horses. [Note] The grate is decorated with feathers. The sound is like aspiration. Also [Southwestern Yi Chuan] Golden gold, Niu Lu. [Note] Gu Yewang said: The grate is decorated with hair, and the horse and bow are also on the grate. [Wei Lue] Liu Bei is good at knotting, and some people use oxtails and buckle, but they knot themselves because of their hands. Also [Zhuge Liang·Answer to Sun Quanshu] The leftovers are too thin, so I will resign and thank you again, which will increase your drowsiness. [Female Red Yu Zhi] Linchuan Wang Hong's concubine Jiang Wuwei is good at horseback riding, with cuiluzhu restraints, and Yuke golden stirrups. 【Xin Yu's Poems】Jin Ji Cui Mu communicates with each other.　I put on the ornament again. [Dong Ba·Yufu Zhi] The internal servants add gold, and the cicada tail is attached, which is called the Huiwen crown.　 Also named. [Jindong Palace Old Events] The crown prince accepts? There are two white scribbles.　Also known as Jin. [Internal Code·Translation Name Collection] Tuoluo Brocade, which is also called “Tuo Luo Lu”.　 Also known as vanilla. 【Guo Pu·Jiang Fu】Yang Hao 擢 purple velvet. [Note] Both grate and velvet are vanilla.　The name of the rattan. 【Qi Min Yaoshu】The vines are as big as Artemisia annua and are derived from vines. ○According to "Fuqian·Popular Culture", the hair ornament means grate, and those who hang down with silk feathers, feathers and grass, can be named as grate.　Different from the head. [Zheng Yun Jian Supplement] 毦 from the ear. Mistakes from the head, pronounced as 眊, which means that virtue is a good knot.

Name meaning
Nothing.
ěr
сущ.

2)* название душистой травы; плети (растений)
